name: Trails & Tarmac Winter BYU
description: Ultra Running event in Brecon Beacons.

name: Tenacious Ten Endurance Challenge
description: Trail Running event in Brecon Beacons.

name: Trails & Tarmac Summer BYU
description: Ultra Running event in Brecon Beacons.

name: Trails & Tarmac 12 hour BYU
description: Ultra Running event in Brecon Beacons.

name: The BOWUM 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Borderlands.

name: The HOWUM 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Heart of Wales.

name: The HOWUM HALF 2026
description: Trail Running event in Heart of Wales.

name: The VOGUM 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Vale of Glamorgan.

name: The PIGUM 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Gateway to Wales.

name: The PIGUM HALF 2026
description: Trail Running event in Gateway to Wales.

name: The RIDUM 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Rhymney Valley.

name: The RIDUM HALF 2026
description: Trail Running event in Rhymney Valley.

name: Nick Beer Llandudno 10k 2026
description: Scenic route around Great Orme

name: Jones o Gymru Anglesey Half Marathon 2026
description: The most beautiful half marathon in North Wales! Flanked by breathtaking views of Eryri (Snowdonia), the beauty and uniqueness of this event is what draws people from all over the UK!

name: Ogwen | Yr Helgi Du 2026
description: Skyrunning event: 40K, 25K, 15K options

name: Slateman Triathlon 2026
description: The most iconic multi-sport adventure race in Wales, combining a lake swim, brutal mountain climbs and a demanding run through Snowdonia&#x2019;s dramatic, awe-inspiring landscape.

name: Wild Horse Brewing Co. Llandudno Triathlon 2026
description: Race the North Wales coast in a spectacular multi-sport challenge, combining sea air, closed roads and iconic scenery in a fast, friendly triathlon and duathlon setting.

name: Black Diamond Yr Wyddfa | Snowdon24 2026
description: Ultra Running event in Llanberis.

name: Trail 10K Eryri 2026
description: Trail Running event in Llanberis.

name: Snowdonia Trail Marathon Eryri 2026
description: Your chance to take on one of the UK&#x2019;s most demanding and spectacular trail races, set deep in the heart of Eryri (Snowdonia) National Park, offering a true mountain challenge.

name: Snowman Triathlon 2026
description: Awarded the Event of the Year (2021) in the Welsh Triathlon Awards, The Snowman is well known as the toughest multi-terrain triathlon and duathlon in the UK. Not for the faint-hearted.

name: Cardiff Half Marathon 2026
description: Part of SuperHalfs Series, largest in Wales

name: ABP Newport Marathon 2026
description: Marathon, half, 10K, mile - flat & fast

name: Barry Island 10K 2026
description: Sun, sea, and sand provide the backdrop to the Barry Island 10K &#x2013; which brings a summertime festival of running to the popular seaside resort.

name: Porthcawl 10K 2026
description: The Brecon Carreg Porthcawl 10K is an exciting race in the seaside town known for its surf, sports and coastal walks.

name: Rabbit Run Wales 2026
description: Trail Running event in Merthyr Mawr.

name: CDF 10K 2026
description: Running event in Cardiff.

name: Aberystwyth Triathlon
description: Triathlon event.

name: Man vs Mountain
description: Adventure Race event.

name: Welsh 1000m Peaks Race
description: Fell Running event.

name: Chepstow Running Festival
difficulty: Easy to moderate. While the half marathon distance presents an endurance challenge, the mostly flat course within the racecourse grounds makes it less demanding than a trail race. Expect some slightly undulating sections but nothing overly strenuous.
description: Half marathon, 10K, 5K on racecourse
notes: Tip: The racecourse location means ample parking, but it can get busy closer to the start times. Arrive early to avoid delays and secure a good spot.

name: Llanelli Half Marathon & 10K
difficulty: The half marathon includes some rolling hills, making it moderately challenging. The 10K is generally flat and suitable for beginners. Training beforehand is recommended for both distances.
description: Coastal course on Millennium Coastal Path
notes: Tip: Parking can be limited near Festival Fields, so arrive early or consider using public transport. There are often road closures, so plan your route in advance.

name: Caerphilly Trail Races
difficulty: Moderate to challenging. Expect hilly terrain with some technical sections (roots, rocks, potentially muddy patches). The longer distances require a good level of fitness and trail running experience. Even the shorter distances include some climbs.
description: 5K and 10K multi-terrain trails
notes: Tip: Bring appropriate trail shoes with good grip, as the course can be slippery, especially after rain. Check the weather forecast and pack accordingly - Wales can be unpredictable!

name: Great Welsh Marathon & Half
difficulty: The course is generally flat, making it a good option for a first marathon or half marathon. However, expect some gently undulating sections within the park, and be prepared for potential coastal winds, which can add a degree of difficulty, especially later in the race. It's not a technical course, but pacing yourself is crucial.
description: South Wales' oldest marathon
notes: Tip: Check the weather forecast in the days leading up to the race and be prepared for potentially windy conditions, especially if running the full marathon. Consider wearing a hat or visor and adjusting your pacing strategy accordingly.

name: Red Warrior Challenge
difficulty: This is a moderately challenging course. There are some significant hills, and depending on the weather, sections can be very muddy and slippery. You don't need to be an elite athlete, but you should be comfortable running on uneven terrain for the specified distance. Walking is perfectly acceptable, especially on the steeper inclines.
description: 5K, 10K, 20K multi-terrain
notes: Tip: Wear trail shoes! Road running shoes will not provide enough grip on the muddy and uneven sections of the course. Also, be prepared for all types of weather, even in summer.

name: Pendine Sands Races
difficulty: While the flat sand seems inviting, don't underestimate the challenge. The soft sand can be tiring, especially over longer distances, and wind is often a factor. It's more mentally taxing than a road race of similar distance, so prepare for a different kind of endurance test.
description: Ultra, marathon, half, 10K, 5K on beach
notes: Tip: Check the tide times before the race! The amount of available sand and the firmness of the surface can vary dramatically depending on the tide, significantly impacting your run.

name: SheUltra
difficulty: This is a tough one. Expect steep climbs, technical descents, and unpredictable weather conditions. The distance alone is challenging, but the constantly changing terrain and elevation profile will test your physical and mental endurance. It's not a walk in the park  proper training is essential.
description: World's largest all-female ultra (50K)
notes: Tip: Be prepared for all types of weather. The Llyn Peninsula is notorious for sudden changes, so pack layers, waterproofs, and sunscreen  you might need them all on the same day!

name: Beast of the Beacons
difficulty: This is a tough course. Expect significant elevation gain on technical terrain. There will be sections of steep, uneven ground, and potentially challenging weather conditions. Proper trail running shoes are essential, and training on similar terrain is highly recommended. Be prepared to hike some sections.
description: 40, 20, 10 mile trail challenge
notes: Tip: Be prepared for changeable weather. The Brecon Beacons are notorious for sudden shifts in conditions, so pack layers and be ready for anything from sunshine to rain and wind.

name: Medieval Backyard Ultra
difficulty: This isn't your average trail run. The distance is relentless, and the sleep deprivation is real. While each loop individually isn't overly technical, the cumulative effect of repeated loops, lack of sleep, and enforced breaks takes a toll. Even experienced marathoners find this format surprisingly challenging.
description: The Medieval Backyard Ultra is a twist on a &#x2018;traditional&#x2019; ultra marathon race.
notes: Tip: Plan your hourly break strategy carefully. Efficiently managing your time for eating, resting, and using the restroom is crucial. Don't waste precious minutes, and have a crew if possible to help with your needs.

name: Radyr Trail Races
difficulty: Moderate. While there are some steep inclines, the distances are manageable for anyone with a reasonable level of fitness. The terrain is mostly well-maintained trails, but expect some uneven surfaces and potential for mud depending on the weather.
description: Radyr Trail Half Marathon &amp; Trail Marathon start in Wales&#x27; capital city, Cardiff but you&#x27;ll soon feel a million miles away as you leave the hustle and bustle behind you for idyllic trails and scenery.
notes: Tip: Parking can be limited, so arrive early or consider carpooling. Trail shoes are recommended, especially if it's been raining.

name: Abersoch 10K
difficulty: While not a flat course, the Abersoch 10K is manageable for most reasonably fit runners. There are a couple of significant climbs that will test your legs, but the descents offer a chance to recover. Training on undulating terrain is recommended.
description: The Ty Gwyn Abersoch 10k is an exhilarating race with a memorable atmosphere in a most stunning part of the world.
notes: Tip: Parking in Abersoch can be tricky on race day, so arrive early or consider using the park-and-ride service to avoid stress. And remember to factor in the wind  being a coastal race, conditions can vary!

name: Swansea Half Marathon
difficulty: While the course is mostly flat, there are a few gentle undulations that can be tiring in the later stages. Good training is still essential, but it's considered a beginner-friendly half marathon.
description: Biggest summer fun run in Wales
notes: Tip: Accommodation in Swansea can get booked up well in advance, so secure your lodging early, especially if you're travelling from outside the area.

name: Anglesey Trail Half Marathon
difficulty: This isn't a flat road race. Expect undulating terrain with a mix of soft sand, uneven forest trails, and potentially muddy sections depending on the weather. There are some short, sharp climbs that will test your legs and lungs. It's achievable for anyone with a reasonable base level of fitness and some trail running experience, but be prepared to work for it.
description: Anglesey&#x27;s most beautiful trail race, set in the stunning surroundings of Newborough Forest and Traeth Llanddwyn, which once hosted the Commonwealth Mountain and Ultra Distance Running Championships.
notes: Tip: Bring trail shoes! Road shoes will likely struggle with the sand and uneven surfaces. Also, be prepared for changeable weather  layers are your friend.

name: Conwy Half Marathon
difficulty: Moderate. The course is mostly flat with some gentle undulations, but a few short, sharp hills provide a decent challenge, particularly around the 8-mile mark. Weather in Conwy can be unpredictable, so be prepared for wind and potential rain.
description: Top 5 most scenic UK half marathon
notes: Tip: Parking in Conwy is limited, especially on race day. Arrive early or consider using the park-and-ride service from nearby Llandudno to avoid pre-race stress.

name: IRONMAN Wales
difficulty: Extremely difficult. The swim can be rough due to unpredictable sea conditions. The bike course is relentlessly hilly with over 11,000 feet of elevation gain. The run is also very challenging with constant undulation. This is widely considered one of the toughest IRONMAN courses in the world.
description: Full Ironman - challenging sea swim, hilly bike
notes: Tip: Book accommodation well in advance as Tenby fills up quickly. Also, practice hill repeats on your bike and run to prepare for the elevation changes.

name: IRONKIDS Wales
difficulty: The distances are age-appropriate and designed to be achievable for most kids. Some minimal training is recommended, like getting comfortable swimming a short distance and riding a bike. It's more about completing the event than setting records.
description: Participation-focused kids event
notes: Tip: Arrive early to allow plenty of time for parking, registration, and familiarizing yourself with the transition area. Knowing where to rack your bike and find your gear will help reduce stress on race day.

name: Trails & Tarmac Winter Backyard Ultra
difficulty: Extremely challenging. While each loop is manageable, the accumulated fatigue and sleep deprivation make this a brutal test of endurance. Winter conditions in the Black Mountains add another layer of difficulty. Prepare for icy patches, mud, and potential route changes depending on the weather. Completing even 24 hours is a significant achievement.
description: 4.2 mile laps every hour until one remains
notes: Tip: Practice running through the night and experiment with sleep strategies beforehand. Managing sleep deprivation is as important as physical fitness in a backyard ultra.

name: Welsh Gravity Enduro Series
difficulty: This is a physically demanding event. Stages are steep, technical, and can be quite long. Transition climbs between stages are no joke either! Expect a full day in the saddle with plenty of climbing and descending. Fitness is key, and familiarity with technical trail features like drops, jumps, and rock gardens is essential.
description: Enduro race series across Wales
notes: Tip: Check the specific event location and stage maps beforehand. Knowing the terrain and key features will give you a significant advantage, especially on blind courses. Dial in your tire pressure for the conditions and bring spares!

name: Sandman Triathlon
description: An unforgettable adventure triathlon, The Sandman has been described as one of the most beautiful and thrilling multi-terrain races in the UK, offering a unique experience for athletes of all levels.

name: Beast of the Blacks
description: The Beast of the Blacks is a great challenge amongst some spectacular, harsh but stimulating trails within the majestic Black Mountains of Wales.

name: Black Mountains Ultras
description: 50M & 32M Ultras.

name: Beast of Llangattock
description: 32M Ultra and shorter distances.

name: The Loop Ultra
description: 32M Ultra loop.

name: Secret Santa Series
description: Christmas themed trail races.

name: Swansea Triathlon
description: Sprint triathlon in the city.

name: Swansea 5K
description: 5k run in the city.

name: Tiny Rebel Sportive
description: Experience the best of Welsh cycling, through stunning valleys, rolling hills and quiet country lanes. Finish your ride with a celebratory pint of Tiny Rebel&#x2019;s finest craft beer and soak up the vibes.

name: Tour de Môn
description: Boasting possibly the most beautiful coastline in the whole of the UK, this cycle sportive takes you around the beautiful island of Anglesey. Clubs, families, charity riders - all are welcome.

name: Pedal Wye Valley
description: Epic climbs, stunning views, pedal with purpose. Choose your distance and take in the breathtaking scenery as you cycle through the beautiful Wye Valley, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

name: The Pan Celtic Gravel Rally
description: The Gravel Rally is a brutal micro-adventure that grounds you in the raw, untamed landscapes and the historic terrain of the Eryri National Park in North Wales, synonymous with its rallying heritage.&#xD;

name: The Big Welsh Bike Ride for Tŷ Hafan
description: Embark on an unforgettable cycling adventure with T&#x177; Hafan. The two-day ride stretches from Aberystwyth to Cardiff, or join for one day from Brecon to Cardiff.

name: St Davids Day Dragon Run
description: Come and get involved in the second St David&#x27;s Day Dragon Run in the beautiful Dare Valley Country Park in, of course, Wales!

name: Loggerheads Trail 5K & 10K
description: The courses are challenging but the event environment is relaxed and friendly. Runners of all abilities can get involved and enjoy a run out on those fabulous trails.

name: The Dashing Dog Charity Run | Wales
description: Come and join the Dashing Dog Charity run in the picturesque Dare Valley Country Park. Not only is the scenery beautiful but you will earn one of these awesome medals!

name: Moel Famau Easter 'Piece of String' Race
description: A great chance to stretch your legs with this event at the start of the Easter holidays, with a canicross race going off before the main pack. You&#x27;ll find out distance and route as you run!

name: North Wales 50K & 100K
description: This event gives participants the opportunity to take in a runnable, beautiful route which follows the North Walian coastline between Prestatyn and Bangor.

name: The Nearly But Not Quite London Marathon | Wales
description: Didn&#x27;t get a ballot entry into The London Marathon? Don&#x27;t panic, come and experience this event instead and earn a fantastic London-themed medal!

name: Rocky at 50 Run | Wales
description: Come and celebrate 50 years since the release of the iconic Rocky film! Have you got the Eye of The Tiger, the guts to get the glory and the will to rise up to the challenge and run?

name: Ultra X Wales
description: Nestled in the hills of the Brecon Beacons, run or walk through wild hills on marked, rugged trails, with big views and remote landscapes in a supportive, adventure-focused trail running experience.

name: Ooops I Ran It Again | Wales
description: Who hasn&#x27;t completed a race, sworn they will never run again and then booked onto another one the following day?!

name: Moel Famau 12 & 24hr Challenge
description: This challenge involves a beautiful 7.2km loop being used, which will test you with it&#x27;s 500m of ascent each time, with competitors completing as many laps of this as possible in 12 or 24 hours.

name: Loggerheads Autumn Trails
description: Dash through vibrant autumn woodlands and rugged trails, conquering scenic hills and winding paths. xperience the thrill, camaraderie, and natural beauty of Loggerheads&#x2019; unforgettable trail challenge.

name: Moel Famau Halloween 'Piece of String' Night Race
description: A great chance to stretch your legs at Halloween with the &#x27;Piece of String&#x27; - at night! You will not know the distance until the event unfolds...

name: Alyn Waters Winter Trails | 5K & 10K
description: Alyn Waters is a great place for trail running! The country park is accessible, the paths easy to follow and with a variety of terrain, and with a few ups and downs to make you really earn your medal!

name: Sea 2 Summit | Offa's Dyke Half/Full/Ultra
description: Starting at Prestatyn seafront, the National Trail waymarkers take you up into the hills south, with the scenery and terrain becoming more and more beautiful and challenging as you go!

name: Moel Famau Festive 'Piece of String' Race
description: A great chance to stretch your legs with this event on the last Saturday before Christmas, with a Canicross race going off before the main pack.

name: Llanelli 10K & Half Marathon
description: The Llanelli Half Marathon &amp; 10K is on coastal course showcasing some of the best scenery Carmarthenshire has to offer.

name: Ruthin 5K & 10K
description: Bespoke events have selected quality running routes, good accessibility and stunning backdrops.

name: Caerphilly Trail 5K and 10K
description: These quiet trails are within a stone&#x2019;s throw of Cardiff and and yet feel a world away.

name: Pontypool 10K Home Run
description: Blow off the cobwebs and start 2026 with the stunning Pontypool 10k Home Run, raising vital funds for hospice services.

name: Ras Dewi Sant
description: The flagship running event is Ras Dewi Sant which is based in St Davids and around the Pembrokeshire coast National park.

name: Brecon  to Cardiff Xtreme & Taff Xtreme Marathon
description: The Brecon to Cardiff Xtreme is the mountain-running edition of the classic ultra.

name: St Davids Day Run
description: To celebrate St David&#x2019;s Day join in Bute Park Cardiff and take on a 5k, 10k and Half Marathon run, or the mini run for little dragons.

name: Barry 40 Mile & Marathon Track Race
description: The 40th Annual Barry 40 mile Track Race (incorporating the 37th Welsh Ultra Distance Championships) will be held at Jenner Park Stadium, Barry in 2026.

name: St Davids Day Celebration North Wales Pilgrims Half Marathon
description: Travel along the Pilgrim&#x2019;s Trail on the amazing Wales Coastal Path from Cwt Tatws to Aberdaron.

name: Rhayader Round the Lakes
description: Set in the heart of Mid Wales, this scenic and challenging road race has been a highlight of the running calendar since 1984.

name: Great Welsh Marathon Events
description: Get involved in this world marathon majors qualifying race!

name: Brynkinalt Running Festival
description: The Brynkinalt Running Festival brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: Brechfa Trail Races: Half Marathon & Marathon
description: Brechfa Forest is one of Wales&#x27; spectacular hidden secrets.

name: The Merthyr Half Marathon
description: In 2026, test yourself against a challenging course through beautiful scenery.

name: Red Warrior Multi Terrain Races
description: 6th Annual Canicross Multi Terrain Races 5K, 10K &amp; 20K

name: San Domenico 20/10 Miler
description: A scenic out and back course along the Taff Trail with a few &#x27;challenging&#x27; undulations

name: Llandudno Half Marathon & 10 Mile
description: Llandudno Half Marathon, also includes the Llandudno 10 mile

name: Swansea 10 Miler
description: Swansea 10 Miler is Here for 2026!

name: Aberdyfi Half Marathon
description: This is a tough half marathon route with 850m of height gain. Two laps make for an even tougher marathon!

name: The Pendine Races
description: The Pendine Sands 5k, 10k, Half Marathon, Marathon and Ultra are all on the beach.

name: Vale Coastal Trail Races
description: The Vale of Glamorgan Ultra and Coastal Races are the original trail and ultra events along this stunning stretch of coastline &#x2013; and now proudly in their 11th year!

name: RTT Gower Trail Half Marathon & 10K
description: Come and join in at the first event of the 2026 Run The Trails Series! Hosted in the spectacular Gower Peninsula.

name: EnduranceLife - Pembrokeshire
description: As Britain&#x27;s only coastal National Park primarily designated for its coastal landscape,...

name: Rasus y Bannau
description: Rasus y Bannau (The Beacon Races) are a series of epic long-distance trail challenges starting and finishing in Brecon,...

name: The Bridge 200
description: This ultramarathon is approximately 50 laps of the Old Severn Bridge.

name: Llangollen Trail 10K & Kids 1 Mile Race
description: Welcome to the most beautiful 10K run in the UK.

name: Bryn Meadows Caerphilly 10K & Caerphilly 2K
description: The Bryn Meadows Caerphilly 10K is set to return in 2026 along with the Bryn Meadows Caerphilly 2k.

name: Pembrokeshire Coastal Races - Trail and Ultra Running Festival
description: Discover one of the UK&#x2019;s most awe-inspiring trail running experiences on the Pembrokeshire Coast Path (PCP) &#x2014; a designated National Trail tracing &quot;Britain&#x2019;s most breath taking coastline&quot;.

name: Midnight Mountain Marathon
description: A unique trail marathon and half marathon on the Brecon Beacons, Wales. &#xD;&#xA;

name: Gower Peninsula Ultra Challenge
description: A new Ultra Challenge for this year, set on the stunning Gower Peninsula &#x2013; the UK&#x2019;s first Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and famous for its golden beaches.

name: SkyRun Eryri
description: Wales&#x27; only weekend of skyrunning! Back with a vengeance for its fifth edition and now featuring four races!

name: Ring O' Fire
description: A coastal ultra which takes runners on an extraordinary journey around the Isle of Anglesey, North Wales. The epic foot race is staged over 3 days and follows the rugged Anglesey Coastal Path.

name: Beaumaris Run Fest Weekend
description: Building on the success of the previous 5 events, the weekend will incorporate races for children and the fantastic Coast 2 Castle 10k and half marathon for adults.

name: Pembrokeshire Half Marathon & 10K
description: The 10K and Half Marathon both start and finish in the beautiful village of Dale and are run on undulating quiet country lanes with spectacular views from St Ann&#x27;s Head and featuring two lighthouses!

name: Cardiff Half Junior
description: An iconic road race around Wales&#x27; capital offering a flat course from the castle to the marina and over the Cardiff Bay barrage!

name: Bangor City 10K & Half Marathon
description: This race starts and finishes in the city centre and goes out to the coastline and along the Garth Pier over the Menai Straits taking in views of Anglesey,

name: Abergele 5K & 10K
description: A fantastic flat fast route.

name: The Snow Globe Gallop Bobble Hat Run - Wales
description: Come and join in for the Christmas Carol Bobble Hat Run in the picturesque Dare Valley in Wales! At this event you can earn yourself a running buff as well as one of the incredible themed medals!!

name: Triathlon Y Bala
description: Start with a water swim in beautiful Llyn Tegid against a mountain backdrop, then push through scenic bike and run routes on fully closed roads around Bala, North Wales.

name: Caldicot Kids Triathlon
description: Caldicot Leisure Centre hosts Caldicot Kids Triathlon. Perfectly located for both South Wales and the South West of England.

name: Caldicot Triathlon
description: Caldicot Leisure Centre hosts Caldicot Triathlon.

name: Trail Marathon Wales
difficulty: This is a HARD marathon. The elevation gain is significant, the trails are technical with rocks, roots, and potential mud, and the weather in Wales can be unpredictable. Even experienced marathoners should adjust their pace expectations and be prepared to hike sections. Consider the half marathon if you're newer to trail running or unsure about the full distance.
description: Mountain marathon in forest park
notes: Tip: Pack for all weather conditions, even in summer. Waterproof jacket, trail shoes with good grip, and gaiters are highly recommended. The midges can be fierce, so bring repellent!

name: Dragons Back Race
difficulty: Extremely difficult. This is one of the toughest mountain races in the world. Each day involves significant elevation gain and loss over technical terrain, often in unpredictable weather conditions. Expect long hours on your feet, potential for sleep deprivation, and a high attrition rate.
description: 6-day mountain race, 315km
notes: Tip: Navigation skills are paramount. The course is not fully marked, and you will be relying on your own map and compass skills for significant portions of the race. Practice navigating in similar terrain before the event.

name: Tour of Britain (Wales Stages)
difficulty: Very Hard. These are the same roads tackled by professional cyclists. Expect significant elevation gain, potentially challenging weather conditions (wind and rain are common), and long days in the saddle. This is not a beginner-friendly ride; proper training and preparation are crucial.
description: Professional cycling race
notes: Tip: Pay close attention to the route profile and focus your training on climbing. Familiarize yourself with gear ratios suitable for steep gradients to conserve energy on the unrelenting Welsh hills.

name: Dragon Ride
difficulty: Brutal. Let's be clear, this isn't a Sunday cruise. The climbs are long, steep, and relentless. The Dragon Devil route is particularly savage, with significant elevation gain. Even the shorter routes will test your legs and lungs.
description: Largest sportive in Wales
notes: Tip: Train specifically for climbing. Living in a flat area? Find hills, use a turbo trainer, or travel to hilly regions for training rides. Your legs will thank you.

name: Etape Eryri
difficulty: This is a tough sportive. Snowdonia isn't flat! Expect multiple significant climbs, some with steep gradients. Proper training is essential, and you'll want to be comfortable riding for several hours. Don't underestimate the cumulative effect of the hills.
description: Challenging Snowdonia sportive
notes: Tip: Bring appropriate clothing for all weather conditions. Snowdonia weather can change rapidly, even in summer. Pack layers, a waterproof jacket, and consider arm warmers and leg warmers.

name: Rhosneigr Wave Classic
difficulty: This event is HARD. Rhosneigr is known for its strong winds and powerful waves, which can be brutal. You'll be battling the elements, so expect to be physically and mentally tested. Intermediate sailors should be prepared to spend time swimming and potentially repairing gear.
description: UK's premier wavesailing event, BWA Tour
notes: Tip: Check the forecast obsessively in the days leading up to the event and pack for all conditions. Rhosneigr can be unpredictable, so bring a range of sails, wetsuits, and warm layers. And don't forget a good repair kit!

name: Abersoch Dinghy Week
difficulty: The difficulty depends on the weather conditions, which can be unpredictable. Expect everything from light breezes to strong winds and choppy seas. Some races will be technically challenging, others more about boat speed and strategy. Fitness-wise, it's not excessively strenuous but requires stamina to sail for several hours each day.
description: Major sailing regatta
notes: Tip: Book accommodation well in advance as Abersoch gets very busy during Dinghy Week. Also, familiarize yourself with the local tidal conditions as they can significantly impact race strategy.

name: Red Bull Hardline
difficulty: Brutally difficult. This is widely considered the hardest downhill course *ever* conceived. Expect near-vertical rock rolls, massive jumps, technical singletrack sections littered with roots and rocks, and constantly changing weather conditions. Crashes are common, and even finishing is an achievement.
description: World's toughest downhill MTB race
notes: Tip: If you're planning to spectate, wear appropriate footwear for hiking in muddy conditions, be prepared for unpredictable weather, and choose your viewing spot wisely. Some areas are only accessible via steep, challenging trails.

name: Coed y Brenin Enduro
difficulty: This is a physically and technically demanding race. Stages are long, and the transitions can be tough, especially if the weather turns. Expect steep climbs, tight switchbacks, and plenty of rocks and roots. Fitness is important, but bike handling is crucial for a good time and avoiding mechanicals.
description: Popular enduro event
notes: Tip: Tyre choice is critical! Opt for robust tyres with good grip and sidewall protection. Coed y Brenin is known for its sharp rocks, and punctures are common.

name: World Bog Snorkelling Championships
difficulty: Low impact but surprisingly strenuous. The cold water and restricted breathing make it harder than it looks. The trench is relatively short, but expect to swallow some bog water and struggle with visibility.
description: Unique bog snorkelling race
notes: Tip: Practice using your snorkel and mask beforehand, especially if you're not a regular swimmer. Keeping water out of your face can make a big difference to your enjoyment!

name: Man vs Horse Marathon
difficulty: This is a tough event, no question. The course is primarily off-road, with significant elevation gain, river crossings, and unpredictable terrain. Expect mud, steep climbs, and potentially challenging weather conditions. Proper trail running shoes are essential.
description: Runners vs horses over 22 miles
notes: Tip: Bring gaiters! Seriously, the mud is legendary. Also, practice running or cycling in similar off-road conditions before the event to avoid unpleasant surprises.

name: Welsh One Day Hill Climb
difficulty: Very Hard. This isn't a sportive; it's a hardcore hill climb event. Expect significant elevation gain over the course of the day, with individual climbs that will push you to your absolute limit. Proper training is essential, and be prepared to suffer!
description: Uphill cycling time trial
notes: Tip: Pack for all types of weather. Wales is notorious for its unpredictable conditions, so be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine, potentially all in the same day. Layers are your friend!

name: Saundersfoot Triathlon
description: Sprint triathlon.

name: Wales Adventure Triathlon
description: A two-day adventure triathlon combining SUP, bike and trail on day one, followed by gorge walking, caving and zip-wiring for an unforgettable weekend challenge.

name: Summit 2 Sea - The Offa's Dyke Half Marathon
description: Gather on the summit of Moel y Parc at over 1300ft and follow the Offa&#x27;s Dyke National Trail to the coast to finish line on the beach at Prestatyn.

name: 24 Hours South | The Offa's Dyke Ultra
description: The finish line is unique to you: 24 hours after the mass start, the race shall stop and the Solo Runners and Teams furthest South on the National Trail, shall be declared winners.

name: The Llangollen 50K
description: A truly beautiful area of North Wales! The route uses two way-marked 15-mile linear routes either side of the river, to create a spectacular, challenging excursion in and above the valley.

name: Town to Tower 10K | Ruthin to Moel Famau Uphill Race
description: Ruthin has recently been recognised as one of the best places to live in the UK. This is a cracking 10K route which takes you to the top of Moel Famau, the highest point of the Clwydian Hills.

name: Brenig Way 50K Trail
description: This regional marked footpath of 32 miles winds it&#x27;s way through some beautifully remote upland scenery. Start at the town of Corwen in the Dee Valley, and follow the signage up the Dee Valley.

name: Vale of Clwyd 5K
description: The route is exactly 5K, multi-terrain in nature, with a nice mix of minor road and trail to make for an interesting run in lovely surroundings, with fantastic views. Chip timing, prizes and medal!

name: Trails & Tarmac Backyard Ultra - Winter
description: Trails &amp; Tarmac Backyard Ultra - Winter

name: Brecon to Cardiff Ultra
description: The Brecon to Cardiff Ultra is a 43-mile, fully marked, point-to-point race following the Taff River from the heart of the Bannau Brycheiniog (Brecon Beacons) National Park...

name: The KLA City of Newport Half Marathon
description: Run through the heart of the City of Newport and the historic village of Caerleon.

name: Colour Run Cymru
description: Looking for something fun and a bit different to add to your running calendar this year?

name: The Feel Good 10K
description: Join in on International Women&#x2019;s Day 2026 in beautiful Abersoch for a joyful, inclusive day at the heart of SheUltra&#xAE;&#xFE0F;

name: Welshpool 10K Run
description: The Welshpool 10k brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: South Wales 200
description: It&#x2019;s time to get wild! The ultimate 200 mile ultra marathon in Wales.

name: Wrexham 10K
description: The Wrexham 10k  brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: Colour Run Swansea
description: Looking for something fun and a bit different to add to your running calendar this year?

name: Snowdonia Half Marathon
description: One of The UK&#x2019;s Toughest Half Marathons Warning! Warning! Warning! This is very tough! This is very tough!

name: Newtown 10K Run
description: The Newtown 10k brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: The North Wales Pilgrim Trail Marathon
description: From the dramatic peaks of Yr Eifl to the seaside village of Aberdaron. 26.3 miles of ancient pilgrim paths and spectacular views

name: Lake Vyrnwy 10K
description: The Lake Vyrnwy 10k (approx) brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: Chirk 10K Run
description: The Chirk 10k brings together an active community of people taking part in sporting events for reasons ranging from fitness, competition, charity, health, fun or to simply finish.

name: Caernarfon Half Marathon
description: A scenic Half Marathon that starts and finishes next to the majestic Caernarfon castle, a route with a few small ups and some long fast downhill sections.

name: Dragon’s Back Race
description: Considered to be one of the toughest mountain races in the world, participants attempting the Full Course will need to cover 380km with 16,400m of ascent along the Dragon&#x2019;s Back of Wales.

name: Lake Vyrnwy Half Marathon
description: Perfect for all runners as well as those seeking a fast time.

name: Tenby 10K
description: A Tenby 10k in aid of Paul Sartori - a fun and challenging race through the beautiful town of Tenby! A two lap course on traffic free closed roads.

name: The Anglesey 3 Peaks Run Challenge
description: Taking in the 3 of the highest tops on the beautiful Isle of Anglesey, this 55km challenge covers some stunning coastal and inland trails and scenery,...

name: Loggerheads Half Marathon
description: The new Loggerheads Half Marathon promises to be a great addition to the existing Spring and Autumn Trail events!

name: Llandudno 5K Santa Dash
description: This is a real family event where even the family pet is welcome to come along and join in the festivities.

name: THE ROC WALES
description: The totally unique ROC format, from Abersoch Bay to the top of Wales&#x2019; highest mountain and back. Swim, Bike, Mountain, Bike, Run; THE ROC WALES is triathlon - tough and redefined.
